artists.name: Abdelrahman al-Muzayen
artists.description:
Born in 1943 Palestine, Abdelrahman al-Muzayen is among the refugee children who were forcibly displaced to Gaza during the 1948 Nakba. He studied Fine Arts at Helwan University, in Alexandria, Egypt, earning a first degree in 1966 and a second in 1975. Al-Muzayen was active politically and artistically; he joined the PLO in Beirut in 1967 and helped co-found the General Union of Palestinian Plastic Artists (1970) and the General Union of Arab Plastic Artists (1971), in addition to creating other politically engaged artists’ groups. Spanning painting, political posters, and occasionally book covers, al-Muzayen's artwork mirrors his unwavering political dedication to Palestine’s liberation struggle, which serves as a central theme both aesthetically and thematically.

References:

Dalloul Art Foundation

Palestine Poster Project
